availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Shelby County, Kentucky native. Married to Agatha Logan. Father of Priscilla Logan, Myra Logan, Agatha Logan, Mary Logan, and Lizzie Logan. Studied law with George Bibb. Served as judge on Louisville Chancery Court.

bibl.p: “The Late Judge Caleb W. Logan,” Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, Ky.), November 29, 1867, p. 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville 4th Ward, p. 60. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, stamped p. 232. Find A Grave, "Caleb Wallace Logan (1819-1864)," Memorial #72269518, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=72269518&ref=acom (accessed July, 26, 2017).
